description.plain:
blackbear is the stage name of LA-based producer and singer-songwriter Mat Musto, popularly known for co-writing Justin Bieber’s “Boyfriend,” in 2012. Later, Musto reinvented himself—he coined the name blackbear from a previous EP titled Year of the Blackbear. Under his new name, he started leaning more towards rapping and an R&B-oriented style.

His first mixtape Sex included collaborations with his peers James Blake, Maejor Ali, and “Boyfriend” co-writer Mike Posner. The Afterglow followed in 2014.

In 2015, blackbear released “idfc,” as the lead single from his debut album Deadroses. It increased his fan following and revenue, earning him millions of playback streams and a spot on Billboard’s Uncharted List of Undiscovered and Upcoming Artists. The second single, “90210,” included a feature from G-Eazy—blackbear made an appearance in his 2014 track, “Remember You.”

In that same year, blackbear released his sophomore record Help, which was a look into good and the bad lifestyle he has lived as a successful artist in the industry.

In 2016, Drink Bleach EP dropped as a “4/20” offering. He was joined, once again, by Mike Posner on “Obvious.”

In early 2017, the newly formed duo between blackbear and frequent collaborator Mike Posner, mansionz released “Rich White Girls”. This would go on to be one of the leading singles off their self-titled debut album, released on March 24, 2017. Mansionz would peak at #67 on the Billboard Top 200 List.

On the 1st of February, before the release of Mansionz, blackbear hinted at an album in a tweet

hell is where i dreamt of u and woke up alone 4/20

This album would go on to become digital druglord, released on April 20th, 2017, which featured the lead single  “do re mi,” blackbear’s biggest song since “idfc.” digital druglord peaked at #14 on the Billboard Top 200 List, and “do re mi” peaked at #87 on the Hot 100 List.

In between the release of Mansionz and digital druglord, blackbear released the Salt EP, a collection of three short acoustic songs he allegedly recorded in a week up in the mountains of Salt Lake City after the girl he was with had left him there. Nobody knows who this girl is, but that’s what happened. blackbear didn’t put the Salt EP on his Spotify but it was released on his SoundCloud.

On November 27th, 2017 blackbear released his highly anticipated EP, cybersex. He began posting singles for this album on October 6th, 2017, with the release of the lead single for the EP, “playboy shit” with rapper lil aaron. cybersex has been marked as a “genre-bending” album, blending in multiple styles of blackbear, most importantly his older style, relating back to The Afterglow, which was blackbear’s first album, and his more recent, trap style, found in digital druglord, which was released in early 2017. cybersex includes features, from artists like Machine Gun Kelly, Rick Ross, T-Pain, and more.

The release of ANONYMOUS came on April 26, 2019. The album was originally planned to be released on Valentine’s Day 2019, but was pushed back due to his label and him wanting it to be perfect. While fans were waiting two months for the release, bear released 5 singles including “1 SIDED LOVE” and “SWEAR TO GOD.”

The release of blackbear’s fifth studio album, everything means nothing, marked his true mainstream breakthrough with the release of the album’s hit lead single, “hot girl bummer” which reached a peak of number 11 on the Billboard Hot 100, blackbear’s biggest hit on the charts to date.

At around the same time in 2020 and 2021, blackbear also collaborated with other artists on several Hot 100 hits including “my ex’s best friend” with Machine Gun Kelly, “Hate The Way” with G-Eazy, “Memory” with Kane Brown, and “Monsters” with All Time Low and Demi Lovato. These collaborations peaked at numbers 20, 71, 50, and 55 on the Hot 100, respectively.

2021 also saw solo success for blackbear with the release of his seventh EP, misery lake, which peaked at #102 on the Billboard 200 albums chart, becoming his highest-charting EP, and spawning the single “@ my worst”, which peaked at the number six spot on the Bubbling Under Hot 100 chart. In the same year, he also saw one of his biggest songs as a songwriter, reaching the number 13 spot on the Hot 100 as one of the writer’s of Maroon 5 and Megan Thee Stallion’s hit single “Beautiful Mistakes”.

blackbear continued his rise into the mainstream in 2022, charting on the Hot 100 through features on Machine Gun Kelly’s “make up sex” and BoyWithUke’s “IDGAF”, which peaked at #56 and #99, respectively.

songs.title: ​hot girl bummer

description.plain:
“hot girl bummer,” blackbear’s first single since his fifth studio album, ANONYMOUS, was released alongside a low-budget music video directed by Gilbert Trejo, which blackbear and his best friend Cesar Silva creative directed.  This was followed on November 21st, 2019 by a new, higher budget video via Vevo, directed by Adam Powell.

The song is blackbear’s spin on the #hotgirlsummer trend. Megan Thee Stallion fans, who created the trend, inspiring the song “Hot Girl Summer” reacted negatively to the song, claiming that blackbear appropriated the idea of the song. blackbear, however, claimed the song “has to do [with] the caption trend” and doesn’t parody the song. In fact, he teased the song and title during July 2019, before the release of Megan’s “Hot Girl Summer” on August 9th, 2019.

On the cover art of this playful, energetic track, Maddy Crum, who was previously featured in Aidan Cullen-directed short film, THE ANONYMOUS SAGA, is pictured with a face covered in colorful stickers and a nosebleed. She shared an Instagram story wearing merchandise and another using the official Snapchat filter designed by Harley Wrecks to mimic the cover a few hours before release.

The release date, August 23rd, 2019, marks the one year anniversary of “the 1” and the sixth year anniversary of “N Y L A,” both singles of his.

songs.embed_content: Read “​hot girl bummer” by ​blackbear on Genius

songs.title: ​do re mi

description.plain:
Blackbear channels his frustration in the leading single off his 2017 album digital druglord, which is an ode to a failing relationship with an evidently conceited and self-centered girl.

Throughout the song, it becomes apparent that the girl in question is extremely privileged, and takes advantage of the sort of attention she receives from men – particularly rich and famous ones.

The chorus is a play on the “Solfège” harmonic scale commonly used in music education to teach pitch: do, re, mi, fa, so, la, ti, do.

songs.title: ​idfc

description.plain: On the standout and lead single off of his album deadroses, “idfc“ details blackbear’s complex feelings for a girl. Even though he has feelings for her, he acts like he doesn’t care about all of her mistakes, when in reality they hurt him deep inside. This girl is likely classified as a “player“ or “slut“ given the descriptions bear gives, but despite this, bear fell for her, only for her to break his heart.
